title-group.article-title: THE LEAST INERT PRIME IN A REAL QUADRATIC FIELD

abstract.p: In this paper, we prove that for any positive fundamental discriminant D > 1596, there is always at least one prime p ≤ D 0.45 such that the Kronecker symbol (D/p) = -1. This improves a result of Granville, Mollin and Williams, where they showed that the least inert prime p in a real quadratic field of discriminant D > 3705 is at most √D/2. We use a "smoothed" version of the Pólya—Vinogradov inequality, which is very useful for numerically explicit estimates.
